Package neureka.abstraction

Class AbstractTensor<InstanceType>

  • java.lang.Object
    • neureka.abstraction.AbstractComponentOwner
      • neureka.abstraction.AbstractTensor<InstanceType>
  • Type Parameters:
    InstanceType - The final inheritance tip is the Tsr class which is also this type
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Tsr
    public abstract class AbstractTensor<InstanceType>
extends AbstractComponentOwner
    This is the precursor class to the final Tsr class from which tensor instances can be created. The inheritance model of a tensor is structured as follows: Tsr inherits from AbstractTensor which inherits from AbstractComponentOwner The inheritance model is linear, meaning that all classes involved are not extended more than once.

      • _addOrReject

        protected java.lang.Object _addOrReject​(java.lang.Object newComponent)
        This method is executed when a new Component is added to the tensor. The public add method is implemented in the super class 'AbstractComponentOwner' from which this class inherits. In this super class the component logic is implemented.
        Specified by:
        _addOrReject in class AbstractComponentOwner
        Parameters:
        newComponent - A component used to access features. (GraphNode, Index, Relation, int[], ...)
        Returns:
        The unchanged object or maybe in future versions: null (component rejected)

        public Device device()
        Returns:
